verses.verse: When a man<WH376> taketh<WH3947> a wife<WH802>, and marrieth<WH1166> her<WH4672>, then it shall be, if she find no favor<WH2580> in his eyes<WH5869>, because he hath found<WH4672> some<WH1697> unseemly<WH6172> thing in her<WH3789>, that he shall write her a bill<WH5612> of divorcement<WH3748>, and give<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and send<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>.
And when she is departed out<WH3318> of his house<WH1004>, she may go<WH1980> and be another<WH312> man<WH376>'s wife.

And if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> hate<WH8130> her<WH3789>, and write her a bill<WH5612> of divorcement<WH3748>, and give<WH5414> it in her hand<WH3027>, and send<WH7971> her out of his house<WH1004>; or if the latter<WH314> husband<WH376> die<WH4191>, who took<WH3947> her to be his wife<WH802>;

her former<WH7223> husband<WH1167>, who sent her away<WH7971>, may<WH3201> not take<WH3947> her again<WH7725> to be his wife<WH802>, after<WH310> that she is defiled<WH2930>; for that is abomination<WH8441> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>: and thou shalt not cause the land<WH776> to sin<WH2398>, which Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee for an inheritance<WH5159>.

When a man<WH376> taketh<WH3947> a new<WH2319> wife<WH802>, he shall not go out<WH3318> in the host<WH6635>, neither shall he be charged<WH5674> with any business<WH1697>: he shall be free<WH5355> at home<WH1004> one<WH259> year<WH8141>, and shall cheer<WH8055> his wife<WH802> whom he hath taken<WH3947>.
No man shall take<WH2254> the mill<WH7347> or the upper millstone<WH7393> to pledge<WH2254>; for he taketh<WH2254> a man<WH5315>'s life to pledge<WH2254>.

If a man<WH376> be found<WH4672> stealing<WH1589> any<WH5315> of his brethren<WH251> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and he deal<WH6014> with him as a slave<WH4376>, or sell him<WH1590>; then that thief shall die<WH4191>: so shalt thou put<WH1197> away<WH1197> the evil<WH7451> from the midst of thee<WH7130>.

Take heed<WH8104> in the plague<WH5061> of leprosy<WH6883>, that thou observe<WH8104> diligently<WH3966>, and do<WH6213> according to all that the priests<WH3548> the Levites<WH3881> shall teach<WH3384> you<WH6680>: as I commanded them<WH8104>, so ye shall observe to do<WH6213>.
Remember <WH2142> what Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> did<WH6213> unto Miriam<WH4813>, by the way<WH1870> as ye came forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714>.
When thou dost lend<WH5383> thy neighbor<WH7453> any<WH3972> manner<WH4859> of loan<WH935>, thou shalt not go into his house<WH1004> to fetch<WH5670> his pledge<WH5667>.
Thou shalt stand<WH5975> without<WH2351>, and the man<WH376> to whom thou dost lend<WH5383> shall bring forth<WH3318> the pledge<WH5667> without unto thee<WH2351>.
And if he be a poor<WH6041> man<WH376>, thou shalt not sleep<WH7901> with his pledge<WH5667>;

thou shalt surely<WH7725> restore<WH7725> to him<WH7725> the pledge<WH5667> when the sun<WH8121> goeth down<WH935>, that he may sleep<WH7901> in his garment<WH8008>, and bless<WH1288> thee<WH6666>: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430>.

Thou shalt not oppress<WH6231> a hired servant<WH7916> that is poor<WH6041> and needy<WH34>, whether he be of thy brethren<WH251>, or of thy sojourners<WH1616> that are in thy land<WH776> within thy gates<WH8179>:

in his day<WH3117> thou shalt give<WH5414> him his hire<WH7939>, neither shall the sun<WH8121> go down<WH935> upon it<WH6041>; for he is poor, and setteth<WH5375> his heart<WH5315> upon it<WH7121>: lest he cry against thee unto Jehovah<WH3068>, and it be sin unto thee<WH2399>.

The fathers<WH1> shall not be put to death<WH4191> for the children<WH1121>, neither shall the children<WH1121> be put to death<WH4191> for the fathers<WH1>: every man<WH376> shall be put to death<WH4191> for his own sin<WH2399>.
Thou shalt not wrest<WH5186> the justice<WH4941> due to the sojourner<WH1616>, or to the fatherless<WH3490>, nor take<WH2254> the widow<WH490>'s raiment<WH899> to pledge<WH2254>;

When thou reapest<WH7114> thy harvest<WH7105> in thy field<WH7704>, and hast forgot<WH7911> a sheaf<WH6016> in the field<WH7704>, thou shalt not go again<WH7725> to fetch<WH3947> it<WH1616>: it shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>; that Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> may bless<WH1288> thee in all the work<WH4639> of thy hands<WH3027>.

When thou beatest<WH2251> thine olive-tree<WH2132>, thou shalt not go over the boughs<WH6286> again<WH310>: it shall be for the sojourner<WH1616>, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.

When thou gatherest<WH1219> the grapes of thy vineyard<WH3754>, thou shalt not glean<WH5953> it after<WH310> thee<WH1616>: it shall be for the sojourner, for the fatherless<WH3490>, and for the widow<WH490>.
And thou shalt remember<WH2142> that thou wast a bondman<WH5650> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>: therefore I command<WH6680> thee to do<WH6213> this thing<WH1697>.
